messages.message:
Hi Team,
I have concerns about the naming of the "Converse" app.

References to "Converse", "Chat", "Have conversations with any document with Converse, built on GPT models" all imply that you can actually hold a conversation (in ChatGPT style).

The converse app currently has no memory of previous prompts and answers each time you enter a new prompt, so raising user's expectations that they can chat back-and-forth with a document then makes the whole app feel broken.

Can we either...
A) Rename the app to something else like "Explore" so that user's aren't expecting a conversational experience which will then make the app feel broken
B) Implement memory of previous prompts and responses so that the user can actually 'converse' back-and-forth with the document.
